articles.author: JAKE COYLE
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — “Oppenheimer,” a solemn three-hour biopic that became an unlikely billion-dollar box-office sensation, was crowned best picture at a 96th Academy Awards that doubled as a coronation for Christopher Nolan.
articles.title: 'Oppenheimer' crowned best picture at an Academy Awards shadowed by war

articles.author: BY LINDSEY BAHR and CHRISTOPHER WEBER
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Mstyslav Chernov’s “20 Days in Mariupol,” a harrowing first-person account of the early days of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine in 2022, won the best documentary Oscar on Sunday night.
articles.title: '20 Days in Mariupol' wins best documentary Oscar, a first for AP and PBS' 'Frontline'

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — A U.S. Army vessel carrying equipment to build a temporary pier in Gaza was heading to the Mediterranean on Sunday, after U.S. President Joe Biden announced plans to increase aid deliveries by sea to the besieged enclave where hundreds of thousands of Palestinians are going hungry.
articles.title: An effort to get aid to Gaza by sea is moving ahead. But the first ship is still waiting in Cyprus

articles.author: BARRY HATTON
articles.description: LISBON, Portugal (AP) — Portugal’s political future is hanging in the balance after a general election Sunday, with two moderate mainstream parties closely contesting the race and set to wait weeks for a decision on the winner after an unprecedented surge in support for a populist party that finished third.
articles.title: Portugal is in suspense after an election produces no clear winner and a surging populist party

articles.author: EVENS SANON
articles.description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti (AP) — The U.S. military said Sunday that it had flown in forces to beef up security at the U.S. Embassy in Haiti and allow nonessential personnel to leave.The aircraft flew to the embassy compound, the U.S.
articles.title: US forces fly in to beef up security at embassy in Haiti and evacuate nonessential personnel

articles.author: AHMED AL-HAJ and JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: SANAA, Yemen (AP) — The leader of Yemen's branch of al-Qaida is dead, the militant group announced late Sunday, without giving details. Khalid al-Batarfi had a $5 million bounty on his head from the U.S.
articles.title: Al-Qaida's Yemen branch says leader Khalid al-Batarfi dead in unclear circumstances

articles.author: BRIAN MELLEY
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — The first official photo of Kate, the Princess of Wales, since she underwent abdominal surgery nearly two months ago, was pulled from circulation by The Associated Press and several other news organizations because the image appeared to have been manipulated.
articles.title: Why the AP retracted the first official photo of the Princess of Wales since her abdominal surgery

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Officials saw the crescent moon Sunday night in Saudi Arabia, home to the holiest sites in Islam, marking the start of the holy fasting month of Ramadan for many of the world's 1.8 billion Muslims.
articles.title: Muslims spot Ramadan crescent moon in Saudi Arabia, meaning month of fasting starts Monday for many

articles.author: ELAINE KURTENBACH and KEN MORITSUGU
articles.description: BEIJING (AP) — China’s national congress is wrapping up its annual session Monday with the usual show of near-unanimous support for plans designed to carry out ruling Communist Party leader Xi Jinping's vision for the nation.
articles.title: China's congress ending with unity behind Xi's vision for national greatness

articles.author: COLLIN BINKLEY and KRUTIKA PATHI
articles.description: Pranay Karkale is spending years of savings and $60,000 in student loans to pursue a master’s degree in the United States, yet he considers himself lucky. At home in India, it’s common to hear about families selling off their land to send children to universities overseas.
articles.title: At US universities, record numbers of Indian students seek brighter prospects — and overseas jobs
